t: Psalm 89
Perplexity about God’s Promises
A Maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
I*pn will sing about the Lord’s*s faithful love forever; I*ln will proclaim your faithfulness to all generations with*ln my mouth.
For*ln I will declare, “Faithful*ln love is built up forever; you*ln establish your faithfulness in the heavens.”
The*pn Lord*s said, “I*ln have made a covenant with my chosen one; I*ln have sworn an oath to David my servant:
‘I*ln will establish your offspring forever and*ln build up your throne for all generations.’” Selah*ig
Lord,*spn the heavens praise your wonders— your*ln faithfulness also — in*ln the assembly of the holy ones.
For*ln who in the skies can compare with the Lord?*s Who*ln among the heavenly beings is like the Lord?*s
God*ln is greatly feared in the council of the holy ones, more*ln awe-inspiring than all who surround him.
Lord*sln God of Armies, who*ln is strong like you, Lord?*s Your*ln faithfulness surrounds you.
You*ln rule the raging sea; when*ln its waves surge, you still them.
You*ln crushed Rahab like one who is slain; you*ln scattered your enemies with your powerful arm.
The*ln heavens are yours; the earth also is yours. The*ln world and everything in it - you founded them.
North*ln and south - you created them. Tabor*ln and Hermon shout for joy at your name.
You*ln have a mighty arm; your*ln hand is powerful; your*ln right hand is lifted high.
Righteousness*ln and justice are the foundation of*ln your throne; faithful*ln love and truth go before you.
Happy*ln are the people who know the joyful shout; Lord,*sln they walk in the light from your face.
They*ln rejoice in your name all day long, and*ln they are exalted by your righteousness.
For*ln you are their magnificent strength; by*ln your favor our horn is exalted.
Surely*ln our shield belongs to the Lord,*s our*ln king to the Holy One of Israel.
You*pn once spoke in a vision to your faithful ones and*ln said, “I have granted help to a warrior; I*ln have exalted one chosen from the people.
I*ln have found David my servant; I*ln have anointed him with my sacred oil.
My*ln hand will always be with him, and*ln my arm will strengthen him.
The*ln enemy will not oppress him; the*ln wicked will not afflict him.
I*ln will crush his foes before him and*ln strike those who hate him.
My*ln faithfulness and love will be with him, and*ln through my name his*ln horn will be exalted.
I*ln will extend his power to the sea and*ln his right hand to the rivers.
He*ln will call to me, ‘You are my Father, my*ln God, the rock of my salvation.’
I*ln will also make him my firstborn, greatest*ln of the kings of the earth.
I*ln will always preserve my faithful love for him, and*ln my covenant with him will endure.
I*ln will establish his line forever, his*ln throne as long as heaven lasts.
If*ln his sons abandon my instruction and*ln do not live by my ordinances,
if*ln they dishonor my statutes and*ln do not keep my commands,
then*ln I will call their rebellion to*ln account with the rod, their*ln iniquity with blows.
But*ln I will not withdraw my*ln faithful love from him or*ln betray my faithfulness.
I*ln will not violate my covenant or*ln change what my lips have said.
Once*ln and for all I*ln have sworn an oath by my holiness; I*ln will not lie to David.
His*ln offspring will continue forever, his*ln throne like the sun before me,
like*ln the moon, established forever, a*ln faithful witness in the sky.” Selah*ig
But*pn you have spurned and rejected him; you*ln have become enraged with your anointed.
You*ln have repudiated the covenant with your servant; you*ln have completely dishonored his crown.
You*ln have broken down all his walls; you*ln have reduced his fortified cities to ruins.
All*ln who pass by plunder him; he*ln has become an object of ridicule to*ln his neighbors.
You*ln have lifted high the right hand of his foes; you*ln have made all his enemies rejoice.
You*ln have also turned back his sharp sword and*ln have not let him stand in battle.
You*ln have made his splendor cease and*ln have overturned his throne.
You*ln have shortened the days of his youth; you*ln have covered him with shame. Selah*ig
How*pn long, Lord?*s Will you hide forever? Will*ln your anger keep burning like fire?
Remember*ln how short my life is. Have*ln you created everyone for nothing?
What*ln courageous person can live and never see death? Who*ln can save himself from the power of Sheol? Selah*ig
Lord,*ln where are the former acts of your faithful love that*ln you swore to David in your faithfulness?
Remember,*ln Lord, the ridicule against your servants — in*ln my heart I carry abuse from all the peoples —
how*ln your enemies have ridiculed, Lord,*s how*ln they have ridiculed every step of your anointed.
Blessed*pn be the Lord*s forever. Amen*ln and amen.
BOOK IV
(Psalms 90–106)
